title: Unblock Admin Panel with in-page password login and hide dashboard controls until unlocked

requirements.text: Remove the red 'Access Denied' message UI from the Admin Panel flow so it no longer blocks access to the password input. Specifically, eliminate the destructive alert box rendered by the current access-denied screen from admin navigation/guards (and remove any references that cause it to render for the Admin Panel unlock flow).

quotes:
DELETE the 'Access Denied' Error:
Remove the red 'Access Denied' message box completely from the code. It is blocking me.

acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to the Admin Panel no longer shows any red 'Access Denied' alert box.
The password input is visible on the page when admin access is not yet unlocked.

requirements.text: Replace the current modal-based admin password gate with a simple, visible, in-page login form rendered directly inside the Admin Panel page when the admin session is not unlocked (no modals/popups). The form must have: (1) headline text exactly 'Admin Login', (2) a password input (type='password') with placeholder exactly 'Enter Password', and (3) a large green button labeled exactly 'Unlock Dashboard'.

quotes:
CREATE a Visible Login Form (No Modals):
inside the 'Admin Panel' section, check if the user is logged in.
If NOT logged in: Render a simple, visible form directly on the page (not a popup).
Headline: 'Admin Login'
Input: Type=password, Placeholder='Enter Password'
Button: A big green button labeled 'Unlock Dashboard'.

acceptanceCriteria: When not unlocked, the Admin Panel shows an in-page form (not a dialog/modal) with the specified headline, placeholder, and button label.
The 'Unlock Dashboard' button is visually styled as a prominent green primary action (e.g., Tailwind green background) and is larger than a typical small/secondary button.
No modal is automatically opened for admin password entry (the existing auto-open modal behavior is removed from the Admin Panel flow).

requirements.text: Implement the requested unlock logic for the in-page Admin Panel login form: on clicking 'Unlock Dashboard', validate the password exactly against '@ni#ra&j*gurja:r'. If correct, call localStorage.setItem('isAdmin','true') and refresh the Admin Panel section so the dashboard content becomes visible. If incorrect, show a standard browser alert with text exactly 'Wrong Password' (no extra punctuation).

quotes:
The Logic:
When I click 'Unlock Dashboard', check if the password is @ni#ra&j*gurja:r
If correct -> Save localStorage.setItem('isAdmin', 'true') -> Refresh the section to show the Dashboard (Job Posts, Settings, etc.).
If wrong -> Show a standard browser alert: 'Wrong Password'.

acceptanceCriteria: Entering the correct password sets localStorage key 'isAdmin' to string value 'true' and the Admin Panel switches to show the dashboard content without requiring a full page reload.
Entering an incorrect password triggers window.alert('Wrong Password') exactly.
The local client-side admin auth hook/logic does not emit 'Wrong Password!' (with an exclamation) anywhere in the Admin Panel flow.

requirements.text: Hide Admin Panel dashboard controls until successfully unlocked: only render the 'Job Posts', 'Settings', and 'Manage Quiz' buttons/controls after localStorage 'isAdmin' has been set to 'true' (i.e., after successful unlock).

quotes:
The Dashboard (Hidden Content):
Only show the 'Job Posts', 'Settings', and 'Manage Quiz' buttons IF the user has successfully logged in.

acceptanceCriteria: When not unlocked, the Admin Panel does not render the dashboard navigation/actions for 'Job Posts', 'Settings', or 'Manage Quiz'.
After a successful unlock, the Admin Panel renders those dashboard navigation/actions normally.
Logging out (or clearing the unlock flag) hides those controls again and returns to the in-page login form.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (shadcn components) or other immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Keep the backend as a single Motoko actor; no backend changes are required for this fix unless strictly necessary.
nonGoals: Implementing a secure server-side admin authentication system (this change is explicitly localStorage-based).
Adding third-party authentication providers beyond existing Internet Identity integration.
Changing admin feature set beyond making the login form visible and gating the specified dashboard buttons/sections.
